title: unban me
body: I got banned because some chogath and kayle decided to troll and greif i think thats so stupid when i get punished because some player decides to throw the game for other people regardless, people like that deserve to be flamed or suspended and because Riots system is so unfair nobody ever does i just think  thats retarded.IM not saying ill never flame again because everyone does it personally ive seen Death threats  when i play league and those  peoiple never get banned.Im just saying I think i deserve an unbann because people in the league community get away with much worse.

replies.body:
> I got banned because some chogath and kayle decided to troll and greif

No, you were banned for your behavior. You had 3 penalties before the permanent ban. Additionally, your last 6 games were taken into account for your perma-ban, so it wasn't anything to do with a Chogath and a Kayle.

Permanent bans are permanent, unless the ban was done in error. This one was not. If you disagree with me, you are welcome to post the chat logs that were provided in your reform card.

The type of behavior you exhibit in game has no place in League of Legends.

> [{quoted}](name=TOCH1EE,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-02-03T09:13:06.830+0000)
>
> Im just saying I think i deserve an unbann because people in the league community get away with much worse.

That's not how it works buddy.
Wrong. He is innocent.

Based on what? He didn't even post logs for this.

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=0004000000010000,timestamp=2017-02-03T10:07:54.389+0000)
>
> 

If you think when someone playing bad then it's suddenly okay to go apeshit on them, then I'm sorry, you're wrong.

It's 1 thing to be competitive, it's completely a different matter to be a cucking dipshit.

Competition in LoL is impossible, due to high amount of unskilled players. So here you are the wrong. Everything below Platinum - is shit. I diamond told me that. Even Platinums have to learn, but still decent. While I suppose you all over this thread are Bronze-Gold that think flame is bannable. Nope. Platinum: 75% in it flame, but they do not report themselves at all.

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=000400000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T10:13:59.816+0000)
>
> Competition in LoL is impossible, due to high amount of unskilled players. So here you are the wrong. Everything below Platinum - is shit. I diamond told me that. Even Platinums have to learn, but still decent. While I suppose you all over this thread are Bronze-Gold that think flame is bannable. Nope. Platinum: 75% in it flame, but they do not report themselves at all.

You do realise if your team is so unskilled, chances are, the enemy is just as worse right?

The game rarely go out of its way to make teams not standing in equal grounds, it tries its best to match players and divide them into 2 teams where they share roughly equivalent total MMR. Drastic team differences only really happens in very odd hours when there are barely anyone playing, but that's no longer a NA problem because you guys have League on basically 24/7 unlike say here in OCE.

You are also allowed to say, rank skipping after a promo if the system determines that your skill level is simply too great for your current league. And that happens a lot when high elo players play on their low elo smurfs.

In other words, the unskilled players can only drag you down so much, everything else is entirely on yourself.

Last but not least, where is the evidence that 75% of the plat is in flame and that they don't report? And what's more, even if it's true, what makes you think that's okay and beneficial for both the game's health and the players' as a whole?

You are kind of right here, but let me tell you, I play in EUW, not in NA anymore. Since I am Bulgarian. 140 ping, no thanks. 45 is enough. EUNE sucks, 39 ping, but sucks. Also all the LoL connection sucks. In DotA2, my ping to EU East is 25 and 33 to EU West and 50 to Russia etc. It is possible even better, but not sure if I achieve it in my MOBA.

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=00040000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T10:36:34.415+0000)
>
> You are kind of right here, but let me tell you, I play in EUW, not in NA anymore. Since I am Bulgarian. 140 ping, no thanks. 45 is enough. EUNE sucks, 39 ping, but sucks. Also all the LoL connection sucks. In DotA2, my ping to EU East is 25 and 33 to EU West and 50 to Russia etc. It is possible even better, but not sure if I achieve it in my MOBA.

It depends on the physical location of the server and how the routes were mapped, along with many other factors.

The 10-20 ms differences simply means they are more or less right next to each other such as in neighbouring cities and/or states, or that one network simply has slightly larger typology. It's hardly a sucking issue or anything to fuss over.

Imagine us OCE players where the server is set on the very east coast of Australia (because our telecomm companies just says "fk you that's why"), meanwhile the west coast players are putting up with 50-100 ping just because they have to go across the entire Australia continent to reach the OCE server? Now that really sucks. This issue is also similar to how NA used to be before they inevitably moved the server.
That is why I will have Eastern / Central / Western Oceania, but with a bit weaker servers than other regions.

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=0004000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T11:08:59.021+0000)
>
> That is why I will have Eastern / Central / Western Oceania, but with a bit weaker servers than other regions.

You won't believe how inefficient it is to set up and maintain a server here, let alone 3.

There is a reason why even giant supernova like Blizzard took more than a decade or 2 to finally implement a server in OCE.

Problems are: Population too low for most games to have a healthy active playerbase, and internet costs too high, not to mention our telecomm companies don't seem to be the kind to welcome negotiations.

Not to mention if it's MOBA/ARTS, if you divide the already small population into 3 servers, the game would just die instantly due to impossible queue times.

**EDIT: But this is off-topic and derailing though.**
Also, please do not continue here. Since we got too off-topic as a chat. Add me on Skype: g.s.vasilev or on Discord: GipsyEgyptian#9008

Won't die. Servers don't require you to have account in different servers, the queue is based on your ping (you can queue in West/Central/East at a time). Also, I won't use Internet from your country. I will bring my own with fibers under the ocean. But before that, you will have to play on the EU one, which will be the best optimized for all. It will be in Paris, France or Prague, Czech Republic or Helsinki, Finland. You are expecting to get 110 ping no more. If not, then I suck at networking confirmed.

I believe that if you flame and go out of your way to add someone only to flame them some more then yes you deserve the ban, im sick of people flaming me for dumb stuff. for example we are at dragon cause yas pinged it 5 times, and there was a ward probable cause a 3vdragon turned into a 5v3vdragon I got focused and died then adc died then yas died after all of that they take dragon and he flamed me for not smiting it and continued to flame me after I muted him the enemies told me that I am a noob and yas right so im getting flamed by everyone for no reason 

smite had 800 damage on it dragon had 2000 hp when I died I think its bs and flammers deserve to be banned
Not all. Sometimes players have bad days. You had a bad day too. You could have played well, and outplay them. And win the fight. Obviously.

league games should be treated like an every day job/school scene where you separate yourself from the stress and play the game no need to tell someone to off themselves cause they had a bad drive home.
Do you ban in real life? No (except if you are a Slayer / Assassin / Murderer / Killer - all synonyms).
so If I have a bad day its justified to harras people online?

so you approve of cyber bullying then

? im not voting on anything

I agree harassment is no place in league, just don't be mean to people and maybe you can win a game its that simple. 

yes theres a mute button but teamwork requires communication therefore why bully the people who are trying to win the game with you. if your the bully on the team then its your fault why you lose.

I have seen a 1v5vbaron before my team was winning and then wild nasus appeared and carried the game he was lv 18 the rest was 15 to 17
so ping spamming lol I can see why this game is number 1 for most toxic

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=000a000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T17:16:36.549+0000)

"People like that deserved to be flamed" LOL. You're not helping your case, dude.
And how did you get your three other punishments?

I think you are right. I got 2 bans so far. I think I am right too. I deserve to get unbanned too. Since flame is actually not a reason for (permanent) ban. I am currently making a MOBA and the Penalty for flame is much more light:

**Competitive:**

* Each 10 negative votes for Disruptive Behaviour - Global Chat Muted for the next 24 hours (each further: +12h.)
* Each 10 negative votes for Team Harassment - Restriction of Voice Chat in Team; Stronger language filter - won't even post the message, if it contains a part of an insult word. Lasts for 4 hours, 
* Each 3 negative votes for Massive Suicidal - Low-Priority for the next 10 games (+30% queue time; unable for compet. mode)
* Each 3 negative votes for Hacking - permanent ban (must be proved, before ban, sometimes even 1 is enough)

**Classic:**

* Each 15 negative votes for Disruptive Behaviour - Global Chat Muted for the next 2 hours (each further: +1h.)
* Each 15 negative votes for Team Harassment - Restriction of Voice Chat in Team for 5 hours.
* Each 5 negative votes for Massive Suicidal - Low-Priority for the next 3 games (+30% queue time; unable for compet. mode)
* Each 5 negative votes for Hacking - Reset account to level 1 but with no content removal / Pause Battle Pass for 1 month (if permanent) or remove it (if timed).

For me League of Legends is not a MOBA. Not even a game. A stupid not interesting mania. DotA2 is at least harder and the punishments are more core-based. While Riot fly in space. Also they ban feeders. Yes that is ok, but why ban.

I have thought unique game-play. Plus if the person disturbs you, you have /mute and also in my MOBA, you will be able to mute Voice Chat and Pings.

League has unique gameplay nowadays, unless you have only experienced League back in 2012-2014 or so when a great ton of champs were just alternative versions of another and kits that have little synergies.

You also have /mute in League. And while there is no voice chat, but you could also mute pings by simply going into the options menu doing the game and slide that "Ping volume" to 0.
But can I hide them from map? I may only want to mute a single person, not all. :) Think a bit, please.

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T10:15:14.746+0000)

There is already a ping time out that prevents players from pinging for a short while if they spam that. You could also just report players for spamming after game if they really do that way too often.

But good job, you came up with a slightly better version than what's already there in League. That's an improvement, sure, but hardly a spotlight to sell your game.

The game will be free. Fully. And you can get almost anything for free, since look at these rewards for behaviour, that is why I do not brutalize the reports, since all will want these:

Competitive:

Each 15 positive votes for Perfectionist - Free Skin of $5-10. Escalates if the player has all of the skins in that price.
Each 10 positive votes for Teamwork - 10 frее spins.
Each 10 positive votes for Mentor - Free HUD and Map interface. Only once. All after gives you the same as Teamwork.
Each 5 positive votes for Amiable - 2 free chests.

Classic:

Each 35 positive votes for Perfectionist - Free Skin of $5. After that, 2 free chests.
Each 20 positive votes for Teamwork - Frее 3 spins.
Each 15 positive votes for Mentor - Free menus interface. Only once. All after gives you the same as Teamwork.
Each 10 positive votes for Amiable - Free chest.

> [{quoted}](name=GIPSYEGYPTIAN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=w1NvVEdJ,comment-id=0003000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T10:27:46.194+0000)
>
> The game will be free. Fully. And you can get almost anything for free

That's simply not financially viable I'm afraid.

The only reason why Valve does that with Dota2 is because they virtually run almost a monopoly on the entire PC gaming scene and have services already done ready to use in the servers they've already put down over the years as well as the very developed Steam client.

Whether you perceive it or not, MOBA/ARTS are actually rather high budget games. Not because the game is particularly great in scale or that it needs very high production values (though it actually does as a whole, but not that much per content wise). But more because of its management aspects.

* How are you supposed to update your game on a weekly to monthly basis without putting in some money?
* How are you supposed to routinely balance and rebalance your game on a weekly to monthly basis without putting in some money?
* How are you supposed to produce and update your contents with upgraded graphics, champions, music/sound, artworks, skins, etc on a weekly to monthly basis without putting in some money?
* How are you supposed to host tournaments for a competitive game without some money?
* How are you supposed to maintain and upgrade your service and systems just as frequent if not more so than your own all of the things above without putting in some money?
etc etc etc?

A lot of MOBA/ARTS came out and died for a reason, because it's a serious business. This is not me trying to trash your dream, but making games in this genre IS NOT EASY. You need money to get a lot of things done in this genre. The greatest challenge of all is maintaining a sustaining playerbase because this is a completely player-driven game. Meaning if you can't keep the playerbase to increase, it will only decrease and drive this game into a death spiral and eventually just die off because of it. This genre is the most cutthroat "go big or go home" genre there is in video games so far.

The closest game that have managed to come out in a low-budget-operating mode that I know is probably Battlerite. They achieved that because the game massively cut down a lot of things from the traditional MOBA/ARTS genre, removing lanes and items entirely, leaving the game as a brawler hence much easier to manage. But even then, it is backed in Early Access, and still requires real money cosmetic and possibly champion transactions to sustain its survival financially. 

Going completely free to play is a noble idea, but it doesn't necessarily mean it's also a practical one. A lot of "completely" free games turned into unbelievable grindfests that literally forces people to pay for a reason, because money still have to be there somehow.
**
EDIT: But this is off-topic and derailing though.**
